name: Local Qualifiers
tip: Tip: Reading the instructions helps you win

actions.commentry: Engel and Gurd here at opening day for the International Smorball Federation!
No idea what to expect from our first human team, the Eugene Mellonballers!
The first Cardinal will soon be coming down the field!
Can Eugene’s coach call the plays to keep the opponent from the endzone?
Why isn’t the coach typing that phrase and pressing enter? What a newbie!
We’re in the big leagues now; punctuation actually matters in the ISF.
Yes, Engel but capitalization doesn’t!
Right you are Gurd! Capitalization does not matter.
Also, those spaces in between words are crucial.
I hope the Melonballers’ coach was told to type Æ as AE.
The regulations for fractions changed this season! Coaches must use a ‘/’.
The ISF has also decreed coaches don’t need to type accents.
Coaches can still click ‘Pass’ or press ‘ALT’ if they can’t type the phrase!
The Melonballers are doing great! Can they hold on through this last push?
The Melonballers are a bit of a wild card this season, Gurd.
Sure, Engel, but their new coach has caught on fast!

name: Local Quarterfinals
tip: Tip: Change your difficulty in the “Options” menu

actions.commentry: The Melonballers dominated their first game! Can they dismantle the Walruses?
I don’t know, Engel, looks like the Walruses plan to use all three lanes!
Here comes a Walking-back! The coach must call the bottom play!
Now the top lane! The top Melonballer is just waiting for the call.
Now there’s a smorbot in the middle lane! Strong start for the Walruses.
The Walruses sent a Tallstop! It’ll take three players to scrap that smorbot.
The Melonballers made some great plays to keep from running out of points.
They’ll be able to cash those points in and load up at the Shop!

name: Local Semifinals
tip: Tip: You only need to type phrases in lanes with smorbots

actions.commentry: Looks like the ISF authorized Bawling brand helmets for use this season.
This is certainly going to change up the game, Engel!
There’s a helmet, Gurd! Will the Melonballers send a player to get it?
Coaches can use ‘TAB’ to equip a helmet to their next athlete.
Melonballers wearing helmets will tackle every smorbot in their lane.
And here’s another helmet!
The coach seems to have an issue with pressing the ‘TAB’ button, Gurd.
Wow, Engel! The Melonballers worked together like a well-oiled machine!
Well, they say teamwork is magic, Gurd.

name: Local Championship
tip: Tip: The ‘tab’ key is in the top left of the keyboard

actions.commentry: Did you know Smorball is the only sport with different equipment every season?
The Melonballers’ coach made great use of helmets against the Bronies.
Yikes, Engel, the mechanics are going to have fun repairing those smorbots!
If the Melonballers want another win they’ll need those helmets, Gurd.
It looks like the 4.9ers are almost out of smorbots!
There were some close calls that game Engel!
The Melonballers might want to hit the shop for some more training, Gurd.

name: Regional Quarterfinals
tip: Tip: Equipment can't be saved; use everything you get

actions.commentry: The Hoarders organized their stadium after last season, I can see the field!
It appears they missed a few pairs of cleats, though.
Those will make the Melonballers’ tackles do more damage!
Here comes a Wide-center. It’s going to take a lot players to scrap it.
Or a few wearing cleats!
New regulations this season: players can only use one piece of gear at a time.
Right Gurd! The Melonballers must decide which equipment to use when.
Hopefully even the Melonballers’ coach can cycle between equipment with ‘TAB’.
At the start of the season we had no idea if the Melonballers could hack it!
If this keeps up, we’ll be seeing them in the Smorbowl.

name: Regional Semifinals
tip: Tip: Press ‘tab’ repeatedly to cycle through equipment

actions.commentry: It’s a fine afternoon in Amarillo for a game of Smorball, Gurd!
Let’s see if the Pantyhose get a run against the Melonballers!
I see the Pantyhose have been stocking up on Wide-centers!
Everything is bigger in Texas, Gurd!
Well, I guess it is ok to mess with Texas, Engel!

name: Regional Championship
tip: Tip: The Breakfast Club makes long words the best

actions.commentry: Can the Five Finger Discount steal victory?
I hear the Five Finger Discount has plenty of tricks up their sleeves!
Those new bullhorns will really help the Melonballers hear their coach.
A bullhorn lets the coach send all the Melonballers down the field at once!
It appears Fort Worth has built some Wingers! Those smorbots are shifty!
Absolutely, Engel, their lane changes will work against the Melonballers.
The Melonballers really took a byte out of the Five Finger Discount there!
Next stop, Atlanta!

name: National Quarterfinals
tip: Tip: Use bullhorns to defeat Wingers

actions.commentry: We’re in the US-East bracket, now, and 3 games from the Smorbowl!
I hope the Portents don’t signal doom for our crowd favorite.
I see the Portents are gearing up for a big rush!
Looks like they really want to score, Gurd.
I’ve never seen anything like that match before, Engel!
I can’t imagine the Chargers will pose a challenge to the Melonballers.

name: National Semifinals
tip: Tip: Combine the Breakfast Club upgrade with equipment!

actions.commentry: Word is the Chargers’ coach purchased some serious smorbots for this match.
Exactly what I would expect from the wealthiest team in the Federation, Gurd.
Gurd, is that the mythical TX Destroyer?
It must be! The TX Destroyer speeds up all other smorbots on the field!
That last minute referee intervention gives the Melonballers extra passes!
The crowd is going wild, Gurd! This is unprecedented.
Say that again, Engel. The Melonballers are the Smorbowl’s first human team!

name: National Championship
tip: Tip: Take out TX Destroyers before they speed up opponents

actions.commentry: Coming to you live from the DweebDome in scenic Hartford for the Smorbowl!
The Nerds are the ISF’s finest – do the Melonballers stand a chance?
They’ve played well, but I don’t think they have a shot at the Dalahast Trophy.
I would love to see the Melonballers take home the Dalahast Trophy, Gurd!
I disagree. The way the Nerds have been playing, they deserve to win.
I can’t believe it, Gurd – did the Melonballers just win the Smorbowl!?
They came out of left field as the first human Smorball team, Engel.
They certainly were up to the challenge. I’ve never seen Smorballing like that!
